body.head: The Tomb of Arnold Schoenberg
body.octave:
The avalanche drifts to earth through giant air
your pure monument's loud windless blizzard,
pianoforte of celestial hazard
strangling the swans of peace with arms of hair,
father of sound whose harp's fallen to earth
in bitterness and snows of savage age.
Ice silences your noble eyes, image
of spring, thus my tears your death gives to birth
body.sestet:
over Pacific pines and the blue crouch
of the setting world. This birth screams in gaze
blind with art's crushing defeat. The dull roar
of incessant soldiers muffles the touch
of spherical music with brutal lays.
I weep upon your bier, this glacial shore.
